How can I retrieve information about a specific identity using the `getidentity` command in Verus?

You can use the `getidentity` command to retrieve information about a specific identity by providing the identity's name followed by "@" or its i-address as an argument. The basic format of the command is:
```
getidentity "name@ || iid" (height) (txproof) (txproofheight)
```
You can also use the command with optional arguments to customize the result. For example, you can specify a specific height to retrieve the identity information as of that height, or include the mempool by setting the height to -1. Additionally, you can set `txproof` to true to return a proof of the ID, and specify a height from which to generate the proof.

getidentity "name@ || iid" (height) (txproof) (txproofheight)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "height"               (number, optional) default=current height, return identity as of this height, if -1 include mempool
  "txproof"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentity "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentity", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
